Pelicula.Critica: Notes:Feast Of Friends, filmed in 1968, was the first and only film produced about The Doors by The Doors. It offers a cinematic look at The Doors on the road during their summer ’68 tour. Whilst never truly completed, the film provides a stylistic approach in true sixties cinéma vérité style. Concert performances are intercut with fly-on-the-wall footage of the group in their natural habitat, sometimes playful, sensitive, chaotic and touching. Other than a few appearances in film festivals in 1968, an official release would never be seen until now. Completely restored from the original negative, as supervised by Jim Morrison, the film has been color-corrected and mastered in high definition with the soundtrack totally remixed and remastered by long-time Doors co-producer/engineer Bruce Botnick. Bonus Features: 1) Feast Of Friends: Encore – A newly produced feature using footage shot for Feast Of Friends, Encore is a complimentary piece which provides a deeper look into the life of the band at this period as they tour, record, travel and even vacation together. The program avoids the typical selection of hits and makes use of The Doors rare recordings to accompany this unreleased footage. 2) The Doors Are Open – A British TV documentary originally aired on December 17th, 1968, The Doors Are Open is focused around the band’s performance at London’s Roundhouse, which took place just days after the completion of filming for Feast Of Friends. Although previously released, the film has suffered from numerous sound and picture quality issues. Now the image quality has been dramatically improved and the sound has been transformed by Bruce Botnick to be as true to the original live sound as possible. 3) The End – Filmed in Toronto, Canada in August 1967 and first broadcast in October that year, this performance of “The End” was for The O’Keefe Centre Presents: The Rock Scene – Like It Is. In addition to the performance it includes the introduction by Noel Harrison and later interviews by John Densmore, Robby Krieger, Ray Manzarek and Danny Sugerman. Many fans consider this recording to be one of the best Doors performances ever caught on film.

Pelicula.Critica: Roger Waters The Wall captures Roger Waters sold-out 2010-2013 The Wall Live tour, the first complete staging of the classic Pink Floyd concept album since 1990. A partir del Miércoles 16 de Diciembre de 2015, sale a la venta en todo el país "Indio y los Fundamentalistas del Aire Acondicionado, el Concierto". Se trata de una tirada especial y limitada de 30.000 unidades del registro en DVD de la película ya estrenada en los cines. Como Bonus especial también contara con dos CDs estéreo de la banda de sonido de dicho film. Los precios no han sido confirmados desde la producción, pero rondaran entre los 600 y 700 pesos. Una caja que contiene, 2 DVDs y 2 CDs más un librillo con fotos referentes al concierto de diciembre de 2008. De esta manera la producción del Indio Solari cierra un año de esfuerzo y dedicación para lograr un documento único que quedará para siempre en la historia del rock nacional.

Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band has been remixed and presented with additional session recordings, and it is the first Beatles album to be remixed and expanded since the 2003 release of Let It Be… Naked. Pelicula.Critica: Eagle Rock are delighted to announce the release of two films by John and Yoko Imagine and Gimme Some Truth Both films, which focus on the Imagine era have been hand restored frame-by-frame from the original film reels into HD and their soundtracks have been remixed in glorious 5.1 surround sound, and remastered 01 Imagine 02 Crippled Inside 03 Good Morning 04 Jealous Guy 05 Don't Count The Waves 06 It's So Hard 07 Mrs. Lennon 08 In Bag 09 I Don't Wanna Be A Soldier Mama 10 Mind Train 11 Whisper Piece 12 What's That In The Sky? 13 Power To The People 14 Gimme Some Truth 15 Midsummer New York 16 Oh My Love 17 How Do You Sleep? 18 How? 19 Oh Yoko! 20 Beach / End Credits 21 Gimme Some Truth:Imagine 22 Crippled Inside 23 Oh Yoko! 24 Jealous Guy 25 It's So Hard 26 I Don't Wanna Be A Soldier Mama 27 Gimme Some Truth 28 My Love 29 How Do You Sleep? 30 How? 31 Imagine: This is the first time both films have been commercially available at the same time

The Imagine music films by John & Yoko Directors: John Lennon, Yoko Ono Starring: John Lennon, Yoko Ono, George Harrison Universal Music Group is celebrating what would have been John Lennon's 78th birthday on October 9 with the release of Imagine and tangentially related items in a number of formats. That includes a new "two fer" released in collaboration with Eagle Rock Entertainment that gathers together two fascinating films featuring John and Yoko tied directly to Imagine. Those wanting more information on this title and its sibling are encouraged to read our Imagine & Gimme Some Truth Blu-ray review, which contains full coverage and more screenshots from each film included on the Blu-ray disc. Imagine and Gimme Some Truth are presented on Blu-ray courtesy of Eagle Vision, an imprint of Eagle Rock Entertainment, and Universal Music Group, with AVC encoded 1080i transfers in 1.39:1. Both of the films feature rather involved restoration credits at the end which document a seemingly ungainly time period spanning from 2010 to 2018 to complete the process. Why that's the case is unknown to me (and the documentation provided with this release doesn't offer any clues), but considering some of the variances on display, especially in Imagine, I'm wondering if completed versions might have needed to be cobbled together from different sources. The interesting interviews included in the insert booklet suggest that at least Gimme Some Truth was sourced largely from 16mm, but both films on this release have an at times grainy and fuzzy appearance that suggest smaller formats. That said, footage like the interstitial scenes featuring Jack Palance look decidedly rougher than the at times already pretty soft bulk of footage, and I wonder if perhaps a few 8mm home movies might have been included (see screenshot 29 for an example of what the Palance footage can look like when compared to most of the rest of Imagine). The palette is a bit more suffused on Imagine than Gimme Some Truth (and it looks like some duplicate elements of Imagine footage may have been used for Gimme Some Truth), though both features retain a generally accurate accounting of the colors. Fine detail tends to vary based on lighting sources and proximity to the camera. While it evidently took eight years to restore these features, whatever corrective gauntlet the elements were put through missed a number of things like hairs in the gate, some of which stick around for quite long periods of time. Screenshots 23 - 26 show some of these hairs (look both at the tops and bottoms of the frames), while screenshots 27 - 29 document some of the rougher looking moments. 01 Imagine 02 Crippled Inside 03 Good Morning 04 Jealous Guy 05 Don't Count The Waves 06 It's So Hard 07 Mrs. Lennon 08 In Bag 09 I Don't Wanna Be A Soldier Mama 10 Mind Train 11 Whisper Piece 12 What's That In The Sky? 13 Power To The People 14 Gimme Some Truth 15 Midsummer New York 16 Oh My Love 17 How Do You Sleep? 18 How? 19 Oh Yoko! 20 Beach / End Credits 21 Gimme Some Truth:Imagine 22 Crippled Inside 23 Oh Yoko! 24 Jealous Guy 25 It's So Hard 26 I Don't Wanna Be A Soldier Mama 27 Gimme Some Truth 28 My Love 29 How Do You Sleep? 30 How? 31 Imagine: This is the first time both films have been commercially available at the same time

Pelicula.Critica: Edición: 2018 The Rolling Stones Rock and Roll Circus was shot over two days in December 1968 and featured guests such as The Who, Jethro Tull, Taj Mahal, Marianne Faithfull and the impromptu supergroup The Dirty Mac (which featured John Lennon, Keith Richards, Mitch Mitchell, Eric Clapton and, on bag, Yoko Ono) in addition to the original lineup of The Rolling Stones Shot in a north London television studio by director Michael Lindsay-Hogg (he would shoot Let It Be shortly after) The Rolling Stones Rock and Roll Circus was a concert filmed with the band themselves as on-screen hosts in addition to performing. The audience were made up of fan club members and it was ostensibly meant to be a BBC TV special for the Beggars Banquet long player But Brian Jones left and then died, and so the film wasn t properly released for 28 years 01. Pelicula.Nombre: The Rolling Stones - Bridges to Buenos Aires 1998
Pelicula.Critica: Die Fans in Argentinien gelten als besonders leidenschaftlich. Auch die Rolling Stones können das bezeugen, denn im Jahr 1998 gaben sie 5 ausverkaufte Konzerte hintereinander im River Plate Stadion. Das letzte Konzert der Reihe am 05.04.1998 entwickelte sich zu einem regelrechten Hexenkessel und dem würdigen Finale, das die Fans und die Stones verdienten. Als besonderer Gast kam sogar Bob Dylan für eine spezielle Version von 'Like a Rolling Stone' auf die Bühne um die Stones zu begleiten. Setlist: 01. (I Can’t Get No) Satisfaction 02. Let’s Spend The Night Together 03. Flip The Switch 04. Gimme Shelter 05. Sister Morphine 06. Its Only Rock ‘n’ Roll (But I Like It) 07. Saint Of Me 08. Out Of Control 09. Miss You 10.
